From: Heather Goldsby <hjg@...>
Subject: New paper applies novelty search to find software bugs
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=441155922; y=6RZ56OsHLMAjQUJTmjYrw2tIgWLH6xBZwBO3413X8A3D7tx7h9i8gfLAen3I1ZO07bqx

Hi Everyone:

I'm pleased to announce a new novelty search paper that will be
appearing in the proceedings of the ACM/IEEE International Conference
on Model Driven Engineering Languages and Systems (MoDELS 2010), a
software engineering conference.

Heather J. Goldsby and Betty H.C. Cheng (2010)
Automatically Discovering Properties that Specify the Latent Behavior
of UML Models
http://www.cse.msu.edu/~hjg/Publications_files/goldsby2010Novelty.pdf

This paper describes how we used novelty search to discover a set of
properties that describe the behavior of software models, where some
properties likely represent bugs. One difference from previous novelty
search papers is that our end objective is to collect a suite of  
solutions,
rather than looking for one ideal solution.

I'm very interested in hearing what the novelty search community
thinks of these results.

Thanks!

Heather Goldsby

Digital Evolution Laboratory
Michigan State University
www.cse.msu.edu/~hjg
